prompt: "If we allow students to redo one test, soon they'll expect to redo every test, then every assignment, and eventually they won't have to do any work at all!"
hint: This argument claims that one small step will inevitably lead to extreme consequences.
explanation: This is a Slippery Slope fallacy - assuming that one action will trigger a chain of events leading to an extreme outcome, without providing evidence for why each step necessarily follows. Allowing one redo doesn't automatically lead to eliminating all work.
visual_concept: Slippery Slope: Standing at the top of a slide, claiming if you take one step you'll slide all the way down (ignoring friction, handrails, and choice).
